ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a decent amount of vocabulary in Portuguese as well as a lot of basic Portuguese grammar. I also learned a lot about Brazilian culture.

The course offered an opportunity for sustained contact with Portuguese and Lusophone culture. Notably, listening, reading, and writing capability and proficiency in Portuguese has increased. For the first time, I feel like I have an established foundation of knowledge and understanding of Portuguese. It was also really nice to learn the language while simultaneously learning about the culture and people of Portuguese-speaking countries.
This class was great! I feel like I am actually learning how to speak Portugus!
Portuguese
I learned about some of the grammar and culture of Brazil.
A broad understanding of the Portuguese language and Brazilian culture

I learnt how to interact with fellow classmates and friends using the Portuguese language. I also learnt how to greet people which is very important ,especially at a school like yale which has a very diverse range of students and nationalities.
I learned how to speak, write, read, and understand Portuguese.
Basic knowledge of Portuguese and Lusophone world.
I developed the groundwork for learning the Portuguese language.
I developed the ability to speak a basic level of Portuguese.

I learned a lot of basic Portuguese vocabulary that I can use to communicate in daily life and express myself. I feel like I got a good grasp on proper pronunciation and basic verb tenses, as well as an introduction into the culture of Portuguese-speaking countries. If I want to continue learning Portuguese, I feel that I have a good base to build off of.
Learned a lot about speaking and understanding the language with speech rather that writing
How to say simple Portuguese phrases and some basics of Portuguese culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: because the class it taught in only Portuguese, I learned how to listen and comprehend very well. The downside of this, is some of the lessons I was unable to understand what was going on.

Strengths: The sustained contact and pedagogical techniques employed by the professor really enhanced my listening, writing, and reading foundational ability in Portuguese. Professor Ximena Gonzalez Parada genuinely cares about her students and actively works to create a collaborative and engaging learning environment. Also of incredible importance, the asynchronous day is a phenomenal addition to the course that allowed me to more fully engage with the course content,
Weaknesses: At times, the course can feel a bit disorganized with no notable underlying theme to the structure. The syllabus wasn't correct in terms of identifying what our final project actually was and the dates didn't coincide with the notable events (exams, presentations, or group projects).
The professor is amazing and the class is very interactive
I really enjoyed this class and learned a lot in a great academic environment. It could be improved by including more english-speaking to allow for a better understanding of the Portuguese.
We could have learned more grammar.
Very engaging and interesting/relevant material. Some more focus on translating, sentence building
More English teaching.
My strength is reading Portuguese. My weakness is speaking Portuguese.
Definitely a more laid-back language learning environment than other Yale Departments. Made it more fun and enjoyable, rather than stressful.
The strengths are that it is really helpful in learning the language. At times it can be confusing though as the class is taught mostly in Portuguese which is challenging as a first time learner.
I think the course is very fun and engaging; I always looked forward to attending class!

I appreciated the frequency of class meetings and the length of the class, as it gave me constant practice with the language but also didn't overwhelm me. I also liked the focus on pronunciation and communication with others as opposed to solely grammar.

One weakness was the way the homework assignments were structured- some of the work didn't give me enough practice with specific vocabulary, and I would have liked more opportunities to practice memorization of verb endings and vocabulary together as a class.

A strength was the Professor
A weakness was the fact that the assignments sometimes felt like busy work

Strengths: It is well designed to get students interested in Portuguese and excited about the language. Weaknesses: We did not learn that much Portuguese and personally I do not feel like it prepared me well for future studies in the language. The good news is you can always make that up.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, It was a great introduction to the language and I learned a lot.
Yes! It has been an incredibly fun and rewarding experience learning Portuguese so far. I look forward to continuing on with the course pipeline.
Yes, you are able to immerse yourself in a new language and enjoy the learning process
Yes, this was an enjoyable course and I learned a lot while having fun.
yes
Yes, great intro language course
Yes , because it is very enjoyable and interesting.
Yes, I would recommend this course because it is a great way to learn a new language.
Yes!
Yes. I really enjoyed it.
Yes; its very fun and easy.

Yes! This course is a great introduction to Portuguese, and strikes a good balance between teaching the subject matter and not overloading students with content (like some other introductory language courses at Yale). It is a wonderful choice to fulfill a language requirement, but is also a great option if you just want to take a class for fun.
Yes I would, I think it was taught well and we are given all of the resources to be successful with the language and the course

Yes! If you want a chill 1.5 credits, to get excited about the language, and to have a good consistent course 4/5 days of the week, take it! If your heart is set on truly learning and knowing Portuguese, though, this might not be for you.
